meanings.definition: To make red or flushed in the face.
meanings.sent1: After running around in the sun all day, she blowsed from the heat.
meanings.sent2: The chilly wind blowsed his cheeks as he walked outside.
meanings.sent3: The embarrassing joke made him blowsed in front of his friends.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected compliment blowsed her more than she expected.
meanings.sent5: The spicy food caused her face to blowsed instantly.

meanings.sent1: She rushed into the room with a blowsed look on her face.
meanings.sent2: The cat emerged from under the bed, looking blowsed after its nap.
meanings.sent3: The wind made her hair blowsed in all directions.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house had a blowsed and eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: His blowsed attire gave away that he had just woken up.
